meanings.sent1: His gullery was exposed when he tried to sell fake watches.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist's gullery cost many people their savings.
meanings.sent3: The gullery of the conman left everyone shaking their heads in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: Her gullery was like a dark shadow lurking in the corners of the market.
meanings.sent5: The gullery of the magician was so convincing that no one suspected a trick.

meanings.definition: The act of deceiving or tricking someone.
meanings.sent1: She fell victim to his gullery and lost her prized possession.
meanings.sent2: Detecting gullery can be challenging, especially for the unsuspecting.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the playful gullery of the clown at the circus.
meanings.sent4: His smooth gullery was like a well-rehearsed dance, leaving no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: The gullery of the fox outsmarted even the cleverest of the farm animals.

meanings.sent1: His gullery in believing every word he heard led to many misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: Being cautious can help prevent falling into the trap of gullery.
meanings.sent3: The gullery of the young boy in trusting strangers worried his parents.
meanings.sent4: Her gullery in following the misleading signs led her astray in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The gullery of the old man made him an easy target for swindlers.
